newsitem.title: BELGIUM: UM to make exchange offer for Sibeka.
newsitem.headline: UM to make exchange offer for Sibeka.

text.p: Belgian non-ferrous metals group Union Miniere said on Wednesday it would make a public exchange offer for its 54.62 percent owned synthetic diamond subsidiary Sibeka in June.

The offer of 10 UM shares for every three Sibeka shares will be conditional on the firm holding at least 76 percent of Sibeka by the time the offer closes, Union Miniere said in a statement following an extraordinary general meeting on the subject.
It added that De Beers would hold on to its 19.56 percent Sibeka stake in order to maintain its links with holding company SGB in the diamond sector.

Sibeka operates in the natural diamond and synthetic abrasives sector and has a 50 percent stake in the Megapode Group, the world's leading producer of synthetic diamonds which is managed by De Beers.
UM had a difficult time with Sibeka in 1996, reporting a group share of it results as a net loss of 125 million francs compared with a net profit of 594 million francs in 1995.
